lines.content: observations: in level 3 when implementing mark as done, the AI suggested to handle errors too, which was unnecessary as that would have been for level 5
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/kraken/Kraken.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Kraken.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Further details can be found in [AI.md](AI.md)

* Entry point for the Kraken task manager chatbot.

*

The application reads commands from standard input, parses them into {@link Command} objects,
* executes them, and persists task changes via {@link Storage}.
* Constructs a {@code Kraken} instance with the default UI and storage.

*

Tasks are loaded from disk on startup.

*

Shows the welcome message, then repeatedly reads a command, executes it, and prints a
* separator line. The loop terminates when an exit command is executed or when there is no more
* @param tasks task list to operate on
* @param ui UI used for user-facing output
* @param storage storage used for persistence (commands may call {@link Storage#save})
* @throws KrakenException if the command cannot be executed (e.g., invalid task index)
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws KrakenException;

* Handles loading/saving Kraken tasks from/to disk using an OS-independent relative path.
* File format (one task per line, fields separated by " | "):
* - Event:    {@code E | 0/1 | [description] | [from ISO date-time] | [to ISO date-time]}
* Creates a {@code Storage} instance that persists to {@code data/kraken.txt}.
* Creates a {@code Storage} instance that persists to the given file path.
* @param dataFile path to the save file
* - If the file doesn't exist, returns an empty list.
* - If some lines are corrupt, skips those lines and continues.
* - On IO errors, prints a warning to stderr and returns what was loaded so far (or empty).
System.err.println("Warning: Unable to load tasks from '" + dataFile + "': " + e.getMessage());
* Save is silent on stdout; on IO errors it prints a warning to stderr and continues.
System.err.println("Warning: Unable to save tasks to '" + dataFile + "': " + e.getMessage());
* Serializes a task into a single line suitable for persistence.
* @return a single-line representation, or {@code null} if the task type is unknown
// Unknown task type; skip persisting it to avoid corrupting the save file.
System.err.println("Warning: Skipping unknown task type during save: " + task.getClass().getSimpleName());

If validation fails, a warning is printed and {@link Optional#empty()} is returned.

* Verifies that {@link Parser#parse(String)} rejects {@code null} input.
* Verifies that {@link Parser#parse(String)} rejects blank input.
* Verifies that unknown commands are rejected.
* Verifies that {@code find} without a keyword is rejected.
* Verifies that {@code find} parses into a {@link FindCommand}.
* Verifies that {@code todo} without a description is rejected.
assertTrue(e.getMessage().contains("description of a todo cannot be empty"), e.getMessage());
* Verifies that {@code deadline} without a {@code /by} marker is rejected.
KrakenException e = assertThrows(KrakenException.class, () -> Parser.parse("deadline return book"));
* Verifies that {@code deadline} with an empty {@code /by} date is rejected.
KrakenException e = assertThrows(KrakenException.class, () -> Parser.parse("deadline return book /by"));
* Verifies that {@code deadline} rejects an invalid date.
* Verifies that {@code event} without a {@code /from} marker is rejected.
* Verifies that {@code event} without a {@code /to} marker is rejected.
* Verifies that {@code event} rejects inputs where {@code /to} appears before {@code /from}.
assertTrue(e.getMessage().contains("/from marker must come before /to"), e.getMessage());
* Verifies that {@code event} rejects time ranges where {@code /from} is after {@code /to}.
* Verifies that {@code mark} without an index is rejected.
* Verifies that {@code mark} rejects non-numeric indices.
assertTrue(e.getMessage().contains("not a valid task number"), e.getMessage());
* Verifies that {@code bye} parses into a command that requests application exit.
* Verifies that executing {@code todo} adds a {@link Todo} with the expected description.
* Verifies that a date-only {@code deadline} sets the due time to start-of-day.
* Verifies that executing {@code event} sets the exact parsed start/end date-times.
* Verifies that {@code mark} uses 1-based task numbers from user input.
